page.title: 14Interview Unemployed Youths
page.content: As unemployment seems to be the 'scurge'of the Eighties we interviewed some unemployed young people in their teens and early twenties.Their qualifications ranged from none to two O'Levels and seven C.S.E.'s.Only one had had any 'job'training and that was a YTS course.Their period of unemployment ranged from 3 months to 5 years. The short term unemployed (up to 6 months), all had specific job requirements but the longer term unemployed just wanted a job. The youth with the highest qualifications had the added handicap of being registered blind. Surprisingly none were bitter feeling that unemployment is a Worldwide problem that only time will solve.Some felt that the Government should be creating new jobs. All thought Benefits should be at least Â£35 a week for 17 year olds.
